bill_title: allow the Board of Regents to sell certain used computers through university bookstores and to declare an emergency.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow the Board of Regents to sell certain used computers through university bookstores. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-49 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding the provisions of chapters 5-23 or 5-24, if the Board of Regents assesses a special student fee to students in order to lease personal computers for the use of those students at a university, the Board of Regents may, upon the expiration of the lease, acquire the computers and offer them for resale through a university bookstore. 250 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.038 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow the Board of Regents to sell certain used computers through university bookstores and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-49 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding the provisions of chapters 5-23 or 5-24, if the Board of Regents assesses a special student fee to students in order to lease personal computers for the use of those students at a university, the Board of Regents may, upon the expiration of the lease, acquire the computers and offer them for resale through a university bookstore. Section 2. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow the Board of Regents to sell certain used computers through university bookstores and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-49 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding the provisions of chapters 5-23 or 5-24, if the Board of Regents assesses a special student fee to students in order to lease personal computers for the use of those students at a university, the Board of Regents may, upon the expiration of the lease, acquire the computers and offer them for resale to students and political subdivisions of the state through a university bookstore. Section 2. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow the Board of Regents to sell certain used computers through university bookstores and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-49 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding the provisions of chapters 5-23 or 5-24, if the Board of Regents assesses a special student fee to students in order to lease personal computers for the use of those students at a university, the Board of Regents may, upon the expiration of the lease, acquire the computers and offer them for resale to students, staff or alumni through a university bookstore or to any political subdivision of the state or in bulk on the resale market. Section 2. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.

FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow the Board of Regents to sell certain used computers through university bookstores and to declare an emergency. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 13-49 be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: Notwithstanding the provisions of chapters 5-23 or 5-24, if the Board of Regents assesses a special student fee to students in order to lease personal computers for the use of those students at a university, the Board of Regents may, upon the expiration of the lease, acquire the computers and offer them for resale to students, staff or alumni through a university bookstore or to any political subdivision of the state or in bulk at fair market value on the resale market. Section 2. Whereas, this Act is necessary for the support of the state government and its existing public institutions, an emergency is hereby declared to exist, and this Act shall be in full force and effect from and after its passage and approval.
